nameEntry.part: Australian Federation of Graduate Women (Western Australia) Inc.
Western Australian Association of University Women
Australian Federation of University Women (Western Australia) Inc.

biogHist.abstract: The Western Australian Association of University Women came into being in 1923, with Dr. Roberta Jull as first president. According to its 1965 constitution the objectives of the Association were: a) to act as an organisation which affords opportunity for the expression of opinion and for concerted action by university women in matters of common interest; b) to co-operate through the Australian Federation of University Women with the International Federation of University Women which exists for the promotion of scholarship, understanding and friendship among the university women of the world without discrimination as to race, colour, religion or political opinion.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Australian Federation of Graduate Women Inc. (1922 - )

descriptiveNote.p: Battye played an active role in the Australian Federation of University (Graduate) Women for many years.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: 'Australian Federation of Graduate Women (Western Australia) Inc.', in The Australian Women's Register, National Foundation for Australian Women and The University of Melbourne

bibref.title: Australian Federation of Graduate Women (Western Australia) Inc.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Records related to the Australian Federation of University Women

archref.repository: JS Battye Library of West Australian History, State Library of Western Australia
archref.unittitle: Records related to the Australian Federation of University Women
archref.abstract: Records including constitutions 1950 and 1965, minutes 1923-1972, correspondence 1958-1969, cash books 1923-1972, membership 1933-1980, history, reports and other items; also material relating to the Australian Federation of University Women and the International Federation of University Women.
